result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy A Triana-Pinto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $100 including of costs to be paid by 11-23-2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy A Triana-Pinto

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy A Triana-Pinto in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Jimmy A Triana-Pinto.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.   Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered:    
Charge amended to Theft, a forfeiture, pursuant to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.042, to which Defendant plead guilty. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.
Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $100 including of costs to be paid by 11-23-2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Robert G Guevara-Salamanca.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. 
Court order signature bond to continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by phone means.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Attorney Tse informed the court that his defendant thought today's appearance was by zoom and requests an adjournment. Interpreter waived.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected plea/sentencing hearing and calendar call in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  ANY IKEA STORES.

Court orders bail to be returned to the peron who posted.   
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jimmy A Triana-Pinto in court with Attorney Tsz-King Tse.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 060286,
Payable Number: 1016720,
Receipt Number: 22RP026439,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/15/2022@1pm
